title: 104_hr1965
content: The "Coastal Zone Protection Act of 1996" reauthorizes financial assistance for the development of state coastal programs under the Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972. The program's timeline is extended to 1997, 1998, and 1999, with funding increased from two to four years. Additionally, the program's termination process is outlined, including the submission of state programs for approval. The Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 is amended to include conforming amendments and an effective date of October 1, 1999. Implementation assistance for coastal zone enhancement is also provided. SEC. 3 amends Section 309(b) of the Coastal Zone Management Act to allow grants to States for implementing program changes approved by the Secretary. SEC. 4 authorizes appropriations for these grants. SEC. 4 authorizes appropriations for grants under the Coastal Zone Management Act, specifying amounts for fiscal years 1997-1999. SEC. 5 amends the Coastal Zone Management Act to authorize administrative expenses and program development grants for fiscal years 1997-1999. SEC. 6 introduces a matching requirement. SEC. 6 amends the Coastal Zone Management Act to allow financial assistance to cover 100% of costs for activities related to damage to natural resources. SEC. 7 addresses aquaculture in the coastal zone. SEC. 7 of the Coastal Zone Management Act of 1972 is amended to regulate and issue permits for aquaculture facilities in the coastal zone. It also includes procedures to evaluate and facilitate the siting of public and private aquaculture facilities in the coastal zone. The Secretary must publish a notice in the Federal Register when the decision record is closed on any appeal from a consistency determination. Within 90 days, the Secretary must issue a final decision or explain why it cannot be issued. If a decision cannot be issued within the 90-day period, a notice must be published detailing the reason, and a decision must be issued within 45 days after the notice is published. This section applies to appeals initiated by the Secretary and appeals filed by an applicant. The curr_chunk is about the roles of the Speaker of the House of Representatives and the Vice President of the United States as President of the Senate.
